title: Container With Most Water
description:
You are given an integer array `height` of length `n`. There are `n` vertical lines drawn such that the two endpoints of the `i`th line are `(i, 0)` and `(i, height[i])`.

Find two lines that together with the x-axis form a container, such that the container contains the most water.

Return the maximum amount of water a container can store.

**Notice** that you may not slant the container.

examples.explanation: The vertical lines are represented by array [1,8,6,2,5,4,8,3,7]. In this case, the max area of water the container can contain is 49 (between index 1 and 8).

hints: Start with the widest container (pointers at both ends) and work inward.
The area is limited by the shorter line. Moving the shorter line inward might find a taller one.
Moving the taller line inward can only decrease or maintain the area, never increase it.
